title: Should we consider science and technology as criteria to determine the level of economic development of a country? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Science, technology, education… are tools to achieve a goal. À country is more developed if the life expectancy of its population has increased, its net non-financial wealth has increased, its GINI index has improved and it has better adapted to climate change at home and through its foreign investments. Example : Norway.

In countries where people are free to exploit science and technology, the exploitation of science and technology is a key factor to creating further economic development. In countries where people are not free to exploit science and technology, science and technology will have no affect.
